custom_terms.definition: The percentage of employees who have changed departments internally within a specified time period. This metric measures internal career progression and organizational flexibility.
custom_terms.formula: (Number of Internal Department Transfers / Total Active Employees) * 100
custom_terms.sql_example: SELECT e1."Department", COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN e2."Department" != e1."Department" AND e2."HireDate" < e1."HireDate" THEN e2."EmployeeID" END) AS internal_transfers, COUNT(DISTINCT e1."EmployeeID") AS total_employees, ROUND((COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN e2."Department" != e1."Department" AND e2."HireDate" < e1."HireDate" THEN e2."EmployeeID" END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(DISTINCT e1."EmployeeID"), 0)) * 100, 2) AS mobility_rate FROM employees.employee_master e1 LEFT JOIN employees.employee_master e2 ON e1."EmployeeID" = e2."EmployeeID" WHERE e1."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e1."Department" ORDER BY mobility_rate DESC;

custom_terms.definition: A composite score indicating the likelihood that an employee will leave the organization. Based on engagement scores, performance ratings, and tenure patterns.
custom_terms.formula: Flight Risk = (Low Engagement Weight * Engagement Score) + (Low Performance Weight * Performance Score) + (Short Tenure Weight * Tenure Factor)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH employee_metrics AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."HireDate", COALESCE(AVG(es."OverallSatisfaction"), 3.0) AS avg_engagement, COALESCE(AVG(pr."OverallScore"), 3.0) AS avg_performance, EXTRACT(YEAR FROM AGE(CURRENT_DATE, e."HireDate")) AS years_tenure FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.engagement_surveys es ON e."EmployeeID" = es."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."HireDate") SELECT "EmployeeID", "FullName", "Department", avg_engagement, avg_performance, years_tenure, CASE WHEN avg_engagement < 3.0 AND avg_performance < 3.0 AND years_tenure < 2 THEN 'High Risk' WHEN avg_engagement < 3.5 OR avg_performance < 3.5 THEN 'Medium Risk' ELSE 'Low Risk' END AS flight_risk FROM employee_metrics ORDER BY CASE WHEN avg_engagement < 3.0 AND avg_performance < 3.0 AND years_tenure < 2 THEN 1 WHEN avg_engagement < 3.5 OR avg_performance < 3.5 THEN 2 ELSE 3 END;

custom_terms.definition: The total value an employee brings to the organization over their entire tenure, calculated as cumulative salary, performance contributions, and training investments.
custom_terms.formula: ELV = (Average Annual Salary * Years of Service) + (Performance Bonus Estimate) - (Training Costs)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH employee_costs AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."Salary" AS current_salary, COALESCE(SUM(ch."NewSalary" - ch."OldSalary"), 0) AS total_raises, COALESCE(SUM(tr."Score"), 0) AS training_investment, EXTRACT(YEAR FROM AGE(COALESCE(e."TerminationDate", CURRENT_DATE), e."HireDate")) AS years_service FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.compensation_history ch ON e."EmployeeID" = ch."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.training_records tr ON e."EmployeeID" = tr."EmployeeID" WHERE tr."Status" = 'Completed' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."Salary", e."HireDate", e."TerminationDate") SELECT "EmployeeID", "FullName", "Department", current_salary, years_service, (current_salary * years_service) + total_raises - training_investment AS employee_lifetime_value FROM employee_costs ORDER BY employee_lifetime_value DESC;

custom_terms.definition: The comprehensive compensation package including base salary, bonuses, and estimated benefits value. This is a custom HR metric that combines multiple compensation elements.
custom_terms.formula: Total Rewards = Base Salary + (Latest Salary Increase) + (Performance Bonus Estimate)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH latest_compensation AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", "NewSalary", "ChangeDate", ROW_NUMBER() OVER (PARTITION BY "EmployeeID" ORDER BY "ChangeDate" DESC) AS rn FROM employees.compensation_history) SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."Salary" AS base_salary, COALESCE(lc."NewSalary" - e."Salary", 0) AS latest_increase, COALESCE(AVG(pr."OverallScore") * 5000, 0) AS estimated_bonus, e."Salary" + COALESCE(lc."NewSalary" - e."Salary", 0) + COALESCE(AVG(pr."OverallScore") * 5000, 0) AS total_rewards FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN latest_compensation lc ON e."EmployeeID" = lc."EmployeeID" AND lc.rn = 1 LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."Salary", lc."NewSalary" ORDER BY total_rewards DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Identifies departments or roles where critical skills are missing or underrepresented compared to organizational needs.
custom_terms.formula: Skills Gap = (Required Skills - Available Skills) / Required Skills * 100
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH department_skills AS (SELECT e."Department", si."SkillName", COUNT(DISTINCT si."EmployeeID") AS employees_with_skill, COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID") AS total_employees FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.skills_inventory si ON e."EmployeeID" = si."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."Department", si."SkillName"), skill_coverage AS (SELECT "Department", "SkillName", CASE WHEN total_employees > 0 THEN (employees_with_skill::numeric / total_employees) * 100 ELSE 0 END AS coverage_percentage FROM department_skills) SELECT "Department", "SkillName", coverage_percentage, CASE WHEN coverage_percentage < 30 THEN 'Critical Gap' WHEN coverage_percentage < 50 THEN 'Moderate Gap' ELSE 'Adequate' END AS gap_status FROM skill_coverage ORDER BY "Department", coverage_percentage ASC;

custom_terms.definition: A weighted score that measures the trend direction of employee engagement over time, giving more weight to recent surveys.
custom_terms.formula: Trend Score = (Recent Engagement * 0.6) + (Previous Engagement * 0.4) + (Trend Direction Weight)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH engagement_trends AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", "SurveyDate", "OverallSatisfaction", LAG("OverallSatisfaction") OVER (PARTITION BY "EmployeeID" ORDER BY "SurveyDate") AS previous_score, LEAD("OverallSatisfaction") OVER (PARTITION BY "EmployeeID" ORDER BY "SurveyDate") AS next_score FROM employees.engagement_surveys), trend_calculation AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", "SurveyDate", "OverallSatisfaction", CASE WHEN "OverallSatisfaction" > COALESCE(previous_score, "OverallSatisfaction") THEN 1 WHEN "OverallSatisfaction" < COALESCE(previous_score, "OverallSatisfaction") THEN -1 ELSE 0 END AS trend_direction FROM engagement_trends) SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", AVG(tc."OverallSatisfaction") AS avg_engagement, SUM(tc.trend_direction) AS trend_score, CASE WHEN SUM(tc.trend_direction) > 0 THEN 'Improving' WHEN SUM(tc.trend_direction) < 0 THEN 'Declining' ELSE 'Stable' END AS engagement_trend FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN trend_calculation tc ON e."EmployeeID" = tc."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department" ORDER BY trend_score DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Return on investment for training programs calculated as the improvement in performance scores post-training relative to training costs.
custom_terms.formula: Training ROI = ((Post-Training Performance - Pre-Training Performance) * Value per Point) / Training Cost * 100
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH training_performance AS (SELECT tr."EmployeeID", tr."CourseName", tr."CompletionDate", tr."Score" AS training_score, e."Department", pr."ReviewDate", pr."OverallScore", CASE WHEN pr."ReviewDate" > tr."CompletionDate" THEN 'Post-Training' ELSE 'Pre-Training' END AS period FROM employees.training_records tr JOIN employees.employee_master e ON tr."EmployeeID" = e."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON tr."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE tr."Status" = 'Completed'), performance_delta AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", "Department", "CourseName", AVG(CASE WHEN period = 'Post-Training' THEN "OverallScore" END) AS post_performance, AVG(CASE WHEN period = 'Pre-Training' THEN "OverallScore" END) AS pre_performance FROM training_performance GROUP BY "EmployeeID", "Department", "CourseName") SELECT "Department", "CourseName", COUNT(DISTINCT "EmployeeID") AS employees_trained, AVG(post_performance - COALESCE(pre_performance, 3.0)) AS performance_improvement, AVG((post_performance - COALESCE(pre_performance, 3.0)) * 1000 / NULLIF(training_score, 0)) AS estimated_roi FROM performance_delta GROUP BY "Department", "CourseName" ORDER BY estimated_roi DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Measures pay equity across departments, roles, and demographics by comparing average compensation adjusted for experience and performance.
custom_terms.formula: Equity Ratio = (Department Average Salary) / (Company Average Salary) adjusted for performance and tenure
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH department_metrics AS (SELECT e."Department", AVG(e."Salary") AS dept_avg_salary, AVG(pr."OverallScore") AS dept_avg_performance, AVG(EXTRACT(YEAR FROM AGE(CURRENT_DATE, e."HireDate"))) AS avg_tenure, COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID") AS employee_count FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."Department"), company_metrics AS (SELECT AVG("Salary") AS company_avg_salary, AVG(pr."OverallScore") AS company_avg_performance FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active') SELECT dm."Department", dm.dept_avg_salary, cm.company_avg_salary, ROUND((dm.dept_avg_salary / NULLIF(cm.company_avg_salary, 0)) * 100, 2) AS equity_ratio, CASE WHEN (dm.dept_avg_salary / NULLIF(cm.company_avg_salary, 0)) < 0.9 THEN 'Below Market' WHEN (dm.dept_avg_salary / NULLIF(cm.company_avg_salary, 0)) > 1.1 THEN 'Above Market' ELSE 'Market Rate' END AS equity_status FROM department_metrics dm CROSS JOIN company_metrics cm ORDER BY equity_ratio DESC;

custom_terms.definition: The percentage of high-performing employees (top 20% by performance score) who remain with the organization over a specified period.
custom_terms.formula: High Performer Retention = (High Performers Retained / Total High Performers) * 100
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH performance_rankings AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."Status", AVG(pr."OverallScore") AS avg_performance, PERCENT_RANK() OVER (ORDER BY AVG(pr."OverallScore") DESC) AS performance_percentile FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."Status"), high_performers AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", "FullName", "Department", "Status", avg_performance, CASE WHEN performance_percentile <= 0.2 THEN 'High Performer' ELSE 'Other' END AS performer_category FROM performance_rankings) SELECT "Department", COUNT(CASE WHEN performer_category = 'High Performer' AND "Status" = 'Active' THEN 1 END) AS retained_high_performers, COUNT(CASE WHEN performer_category = 'High Performer' THEN 1 END) AS total_high_performers, ROUND((COUNT(CASE WHEN performer_category = 'High Performer' AND "Status" = 'Active' THEN 1 END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(CASE WHEN performer_category = 'High Performer' THEN 1 END), 0)) * 100, 2) AS retention_rate FROM high_performers WHERE performer_category = 'High Performer' GROUP BY "Department" ORDER BY retention_rate DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Measures the extent to which employees work across departments, calculated based on training participation, project assignments, and manager relationships spanning multiple departments.
custom_terms.formula: Collaboration Index = (Cross-Department Interactions) / (Total Possible Interactions) * 100
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH cross_dept_training AS (SELECT tr."EmployeeID", e."Department" AS employee_dept, COUNT(DISTINCT e2."Department") AS training_with_depts FROM employees.training_records tr JOIN employees.employee_master e ON tr."EmployeeID" = e."EmployeeID" JOIN employees.employee_master e2 ON tr."EmployeeID" != e2."EmployeeID" AND EXISTS (SELECT 1 FROM employees.training_records tr2 WHERE tr2."EmployeeID" = e2."EmployeeID" AND tr2."CourseName" = tr."CourseName") WHERE tr."Status" = 'Completed' GROUP BY tr."EmployeeID", e."Department"), manager_cross_dept AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."Department", CASE WHEN m."Department" != e."Department" THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS cross_dept_manager FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.employee_master m ON e."ManagerID" = m."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active'), collaboration_scores AS (SELECT COALESCE(cdt."EmployeeID", mcd."EmployeeID") AS "EmployeeID", COALESCE(cdt.employee_dept, mcd."Department") AS "Department", COALESCE(cdt.training_with_depts, 0) AS training_collaboration, COALESCE(mcd.cross_dept_manager, 0) AS manager_collaboration, (COALESCE(cdt.training_with_depts, 0) + COALESCE(mcd.cross_dept_manager, 0)) AS collaboration_index FROM cross_dept_training cdt FULL OUTER JOIN manager_cross_dept mcd ON cdt."EmployeeID" = mcd."EmployeeID") SELECT "Department", AVG(collaboration_index) AS avg_collaboration_index, COUNT(CASE WHEN collaboration_index > 0 THEN 1 END) AS employees_collaborating, COUNT(*) AS total_employees FROM collaboration_scores GROUP BY "Department" ORDER BY avg_collaboration_index DESC;

custom_terms.definition: The average time it takes for a new employee to reach full productivity, measured from hire date to first high performance review score.
custom_terms.formula: Time to Productivity = Average(Days from HireDate to First Performance Review Score >= 4.0)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH first_high_performance AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."HireDate", MIN(pr."ReviewDate") AS first_high_review FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE pr."OverallScore" >= 4.0 GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."HireDate") SELECT "Department", ROUND(AVG(EXTRACT(EPOCH FROM (first_high_review - "HireDate")) / 365.25), 2) AS avg_years_to_productivity FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN first_high_performance fhp ON e."EmployeeID" = fhp."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY "Department" ORDER BY avg_years_to_productivity;

custom_terms.definition: Distinguishes between employees who left voluntarily (resignation) versus involuntarily (termination), providing insights into retention vs performance issues.
custom_terms.formula: Voluntary Turnover Rate = (Voluntary Terminations / Total Employees) * 100
custom_terms.sql_example: SELECT "Department", COUNT(CASE WHEN "TerminationDate" IS NOT NULL AND "Status" = 'Terminated' THEN 1 END) AS total_terminations, COUNT(CASE WHEN "TerminationDate" IS NOT NULL AND "Status" = 'Terminated' AND "PerformanceRating" >= 3.5 THEN 1 END) AS voluntary_terminations, COUNT(CASE WHEN "TerminationDate" IS NOT NULL AND "Status" = 'Terminated' AND "PerformanceRating" < 3.5 THEN 1 END) AS involuntary_terminations, ROUND((COUNT(CASE WHEN "TerminationDate" IS NOT NULL AND "Status" = 'Terminated' AND "PerformanceRating" >= 3.5 THEN 1 END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(CASE WHEN "TerminationDate" IS NOT NULL THEN 1 END), 0)) * 100, 2) AS voluntary_turnover_rate FROM employees.employee_master GROUP BY "Department" ORDER BY voluntary_turnover_rate DESC;

custom_terms.definition: The average time between promotions or significant role changes, measured by salary increases above a threshold percentage.
custom_terms.formula: Promotion Velocity = Average(Months between Salary Increases > 15%)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH salary_increases AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", "ChangeDate", "NewSalary", "OldSalary", (("NewSalary" - "OldSalary") / NULLIF("OldSalary", 0)) * 100 AS increase_pct, LAG("ChangeDate") OVER (PARTITION BY "EmployeeID" ORDER BY "ChangeDate") AS prev_change_date FROM employees.compensation_history WHERE "OldSalary" IS NOT NULL), promotions AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", "ChangeDate", prev_change_date, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM AGE("ChangeDate", COALESCE(prev_change_date, "ChangeDate"))) AS months_between FROM salary_increases WHERE increase_pct >= 15) SELECT e."Department", ROUND(AVG(p.months_between), 2) AS avg_promotion_velocity_months FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN promotions p ON e."EmployeeID" = p."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."Department" ORDER BY avg_promotion_velocity_months;

custom_terms.definition: A composite score measuring manager performance based on team engagement scores, team performance ratings, and retention rates.
custom_terms.formula: Manager Effectiveness = (Team Engagement * 0.4) + (Team Performance * 0.4) + (Team Retention * 0.2)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH manager_teams AS (SELECT m."EmployeeID" AS manager_id, m."FullName" AS manager_name, m."Department", COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID") AS team_size FROM employees.employee_master m JOIN employees.employee_master e ON m."EmployeeID" = e."ManagerID" WHERE m."Status" = 'Active' AND e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY m."EmployeeID", m."FullName", m."Department"), team_metrics AS (SELECT mt.manager_id, mt.manager_name, mt."Department", AVG(es."OverallSatisfaction") AS team_engagement, AVG(pr."OverallScore") AS team_performance, COUNT(CASE WHEN e."Status" = 'Active' THEN 1 END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(*), 0) * 100 AS retention_rate FROM manager_teams mt JOIN employees.employee_master e ON mt.manager_id = e."ManagerID" LEFT JOIN employees.engagement_surveys es ON e."EmployeeID" = es."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" GROUP BY mt.manager_id, mt.manager_name, mt."Department") SELECT manager_id, manager_name, "Department", team_engagement, team_performance, retention_rate, ROUND((team_engagement * 0.4 + team_performance * 0.4 + retention_rate / 100 * 0.2) * 10, 2) AS manager_effectiveness_score FROM team_metrics ORDER BY manager_effectiveness_score DESC;

custom_terms.definition: The rate at which employees acquire new skills, measured by training completion frequency and skill proficiency improvements.
custom_terms.formula: Learning Velocity = (Number of Skills Acquired) / (Time Period in Months)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH employee_skills AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."HireDate", COUNT(DISTINCT si."SkillID") AS total_skills, MAX(tr."CompletionDate") AS last_training_date FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.skills_inventory si ON e."EmployeeID" = si."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.training_records tr ON e."EmployeeID" = tr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' AND tr."Status" = 'Completed' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."HireDate"), learning_rate AS (SELECT "EmployeeID", total_skills, EXTRACT(MONTH FROM AGE(COALESCE(last_training_date, CURRENT_DATE), "HireDate")) AS months_active, CASE WHEN EXTRACT(MONTH FROM AGE(COALESCE(last_training_date, CURRENT_DATE), "HireDate")) > 0 THEN total_skills::numeric / EXTRACT(MONTH FROM AGE(COALESCE(last_training_date, CURRENT_DATE), "HireDate")) ELSE 0 END AS learning_velocity FROM employee_skills) SELECT e."Department", ROUND(AVG(lr.learning_velocity), 2) AS avg_learning_velocity FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN learning_rate lr ON e."EmployeeID" = lr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."Department" ORDER BY avg_learning_velocity DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Measures salary compression within departments by comparing the ratio of highest to lowest salaries, indicating potential pay equity issues.
custom_terms.formula: Compression Ratio = (Highest Salary - Lowest Salary) / Lowest Salary * 100
custom_terms.sql_example: SELECT "Department", MAX("Salary") AS max_salary, MIN("Salary") AS min_salary, ROUND(((MAX("Salary") - MIN("Salary")) / NULLIF(MIN("Salary"), 0)) * 100, 2) AS compression_ratio, CASE WHEN ((MAX("Salary") - MIN("Salary")) / NULLIF(MIN("Salary"), 0)) < 50 THEN 'Low Compression' WHEN ((MAX("Salary") - MIN("Salary")) / NULLIF(MIN("Salary"), 0)) < 100 THEN 'Moderate Compression' ELSE 'High Compression' END AS compression_status FROM employees.employee_master WHERE "Status" = 'Active' AND "Salary" IS NOT NULL GROUP BY "Department" ORDER BY compression_ratio DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Identifies employees ready for promotion based on performance, skills, tenure, and training completion.
custom_terms.formula: Succession Readiness = (Performance Score * 0.3) + (Skills Count * 0.2) + (Tenure Factor * 0.2) + (Training Completion * 0.3)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH employee_readiness AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."HireDate", COALESCE(AVG(pr."OverallScore"), 0) AS performance_score, COUNT(DISTINCT si."SkillID") AS skills_count, EXTRACT(YEAR FROM AGE(CURRENT_DATE, e."HireDate")) AS years_tenure, COUNT(CASE WHEN tr."Status" = 'Completed' THEN 1 END) AS training_count FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.skills_inventory si ON e."EmployeeID" = si."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.training_records tr ON e."EmployeeID" = tr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", e."HireDate") SELECT "EmployeeID", "FullName", "Department", performance_score, skills_count, years_tenure, training_count, ROUND((performance_score * 0.3 + LEAST(skills_count / 10.0, 1.0) * 0.2 + LEAST(years_tenure / 5.0, 1.0) * 0.2 + LEAST(training_count / 5.0, 1.0) * 0.3) * 100, 2) AS succession_readiness_index FROM employee_readiness ORDER BY succession_readiness_index DESC LIMIT 20;

custom_terms.definition: Identifies employees at risk of burnout based on low engagement scores, declining performance trends, and high workload indicators.
custom_terms.formula: Burnout Risk = (Low Engagement * 0.5) + (Declining Performance * 0.3) + (High Workload * 0.2)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH employee_wellbeing AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", AVG(es."OverallSatisfaction") AS avg_engagement, AVG(es."WorkLifeBalanceScore") AS worklife_balance, AVG(pr."OverallScore") AS current_performance, LAG(AVG(pr."OverallScore")) OVER (PARTITION BY e."EmployeeID" ORDER BY pr."ReviewDate") AS previous_performance FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.engagement_surveys es ON e."EmployeeID" = es."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", pr."ReviewDate") SELECT "EmployeeID", "FullName", "Department", avg_engagement, worklife_balance, current_performance, CASE WHEN avg_engagement < 3.0 AND worklife_balance < 3.0 THEN 'High Risk' WHEN avg_engagement < 3.5 OR worklife_balance < 3.5 THEN 'Medium Risk' ELSE 'Low Risk' END AS burnout_risk FROM employee_wellbeing WHERE avg_engagement IS NOT NULL ORDER BY avg_engagement, worklife_balance;

custom_terms.definition: Measures workforce diversity across departments using gender, department distribution, and representation metrics.
custom_terms.formula: Diversity Index = 1 - Sum((Group Count / Total Count)^2) for all groups
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH department_diversity AS (SELECT "Department", "Gender", COUNT(*) AS group_count, SUM(COUNT(*)) OVER (PARTITION BY "Department") AS dept_total FROM employees.employee_master WHERE "Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY "Department", "Gender") SELECT "Department", SUM(POWER(group_count::numeric / NULLIF(dept_total, 0), 2)) AS diversity_index, ROUND((1 - SUM(POWER(group_count::numeric / NULLIF(dept_total, 0), 2))) * 100, 2) AS diversity_score FROM department_diversity GROUP BY "Department" ORDER BY diversity_score DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Evaluates the depth of talent ready for key roles by analyzing performance distribution, skills coverage, and succession readiness.
custom_terms.formula: Pipeline Strength = (High Performers % * 0.4) + (Skills Coverage * 0.3) + (Succession Ready % * 0.3)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH talent_metrics AS (SELECT e."Department", COUNT(CASE WHEN pr."OverallScore" >= 4.0 THEN 1 END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(*), 0) * 100 AS high_performer_pct, COUNT(DISTINCT si."SkillID")::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID"), 0) AS avg_skills_per_employee, COUNT(CASE WHEN pr."OverallScore" >= 4.0 AND COUNT(si."SkillID") >= 5 THEN 1 END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(*), 0) * 100 AS succession_ready_pct FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.skills_inventory si ON e."EmployeeID" = si."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."Department") SELECT "Department", high_performer_pct, avg_skills_per_employee, succession_ready_pct, ROUND((high_performer_pct * 0.4 + LEAST(avg_skills_per_employee / 10.0, 1.0) * 30 + succession_ready_pct * 0.3), 2) AS pipeline_strength FROM talent_metrics ORDER BY pipeline_strength DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Calculates the efficiency of hiring processes by comparing time-to-fill, quality of hire (performance), and retention rates.
custom_terms.formula: Hiring Efficiency = (Quality Score * Retention Rate) / (Time to Fill in Days)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH hiring_metrics AS (SELECT e."Department", e."HireDate", AVG(pr."OverallScore") AS avg_performance, CASE WHEN e."Status" = 'Active' THEN 1 ELSE 0 END AS retained FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."HireDate" >= CURRENT_DATE - INTERVAL '2 years' GROUP BY e."Department", e."HireDate", e."Status") SELECT "Department", ROUND(AVG(avg_performance), 2) AS avg_quality_score, ROUND(AVG(retained) * 100, 2) AS retention_rate, ROUND((AVG(avg_performance) * AVG(retained)) / NULLIF(COUNT(*), 0) * 100, 2) AS hiring_efficiency FROM hiring_metrics GROUP BY "Department" ORDER BY hiring_efficiency DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Measures employee advocacy by calculating the percentage of promoters (high engagement) minus detractors (low engagement).
custom_terms.formula: eNPS = (% Promoters - % Detractors) * 100, where Promoters = Engagement >= 4.0, Detractors = Engagement <= 2.0
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH engagement_categories AS (SELECT e."Department", CASE WHEN es."OverallSatisfaction" >= 4.0 THEN 'Promoter' WHEN es."OverallSatisfaction" <= 2.0 THEN 'Detractor' ELSE 'Passive' END AS category FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN employees.engagement_surveys es ON e."EmployeeID" = es."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active'), category_counts AS (SELECT "Department", COUNT(CASE WHEN category = 'Promoter' THEN 1 END) AS promoters, COUNT(CASE WHEN category = 'Detractor' THEN 1 END) AS detractors, COUNT(*) AS total FROM engagement_categories GROUP BY "Department") SELECT "Department", promoters, detractors, total, ROUND(((promoters::numeric / NULLIF(total, 0)) - (detractors::numeric / NULLIF(total, 0))) * 100, 2) AS employee_nps FROM category_counts ORDER BY employee_nps DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Identifies departments with over-concentration of specific skills, indicating potential risk if key employees leave.
custom_terms.formula: Redundancy = (Employees with Skill / Total Employees) - Optimal Distribution Threshold
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH skill_distribution AS (SELECT e."Department", si."SkillName", COUNT(DISTINCT si."EmployeeID") AS employees_with_skill, COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID") AS total_employees, (COUNT(DISTINCT si."EmployeeID")::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID"), 0)) * 100 AS skill_coverage_pct FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.skills_inventory si ON e."EmployeeID" = si."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."Department", si."SkillName") SELECT "Department", "SkillName", employees_with_skill, total_employees, skill_coverage_pct, CASE WHEN skill_coverage_pct > 80 THEN 'High Redundancy' WHEN skill_coverage_pct < 20 THEN 'Low Redundancy - Risk' ELSE 'Adequate' END AS redundancy_status FROM skill_distribution WHERE skill_coverage_pct IS NOT NULL ORDER BY "Department", skill_coverage_pct DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Measures how consistently an employee performs across multiple reviews, indicating reliability and stability.
custom_terms.formula: Consistency = 1 - (Standard Deviation of Performance Scores / Mean Performance Score)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH performance_variance AS (SELECT e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department", AVG(pr."OverallScore") AS avg_performance, STDDEV(pr."OverallScore") AS performance_stddev, COUNT(pr."ReviewID") AS review_count FROM employees.employee_master e JOIN employees.performance_reviews pr ON e."EmployeeID" = pr."EmployeeID" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."EmployeeID", e."FullName", e."Department" HAVING COUNT(pr."ReviewID") >= 2) SELECT "EmployeeID", "FullName", "Department", avg_performance, performance_stddev, review_count, ROUND((1 - (performance_stddev / NULLIF(avg_performance, 0))) * 100, 2) AS consistency_score FROM performance_variance ORDER BY consistency_score DESC;

custom_terms.definition: Measures organizational ability to adapt by analyzing cross-training, skill diversity, and internal mobility rates.
custom_terms.formula: Agility = (Cross-Training % * 0.3) + (Skill Diversity * 0.3) + (Internal Mobility * 0.4)
custom_terms.sql_example: WITH agility_components AS (SELECT e."Department", COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN tr."CourseName" IS NOT NULL THEN e."EmployeeID" END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID"), 0) * 100 AS cross_training_pct, AVG(skill_count) AS avg_skill_diversity, COUNT(DISTINCT CASE WHEN e2."Department" != e."Department" THEN e."EmployeeID" END)::numeric / NULLIF(COUNT(DISTINCT e."EmployeeID"), 0) * 100 AS mobility_pct FROM employees.employee_master e LEFT JOIN employees.training_records tr ON e."EmployeeID" = tr."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN (SELECT "EmployeeID", COUNT(DISTINCT "SkillID") AS skill_count FROM employees.skills_inventory GROUP BY "EmployeeID") sc ON e."EmployeeID" = sc."EmployeeID" LEFT JOIN employees.employee_master e2 ON e."EmployeeID" = e2."EmployeeID" AND e2."HireDate" < e."HireDate" WHERE e."Status" = 'Active' GROUP BY e."Department") SELECT "Department", cross_training_pct, avg_skill_diversity, mobility_pct, ROUND((cross_training_pct * 0.3 + LEAST(avg_skill_diversity / 10.0, 1.0) * 30 + mobility_pct * 0.4), 2) AS agility_index FROM agility_components ORDER BY agility_index DESC;
